comment:
* Automatically reverses the order of children as they are added.
 * Also reverse the width and height values of layout params

variables.name: mIsLayoutReverse
variables.comment: If true, the layout is reversed vs. a regular linear layout

variables.name: mIsAlternativeOrder
variables.comment: If true, the layout is opposite to it's natural reversity from the layout direction

methods.name: public void addView(View child, ViewGroup.LayoutParams params)
private void updateOrder()
methods.comment:
* In landscape, the LinearLayout is not auto mirrored since it is vertical. Therefore we
     * have to do it manually

methods.name: private static void reverseParams(ViewGroup.LayoutParams params, View child, boolean isLayoutReverse)
private static void reverseGroup(ViewGroup group, boolean isLayoutReverse)

methodNames: public void addView(View child, ViewGroup.LayoutParams params)
private static void reverseParams(ViewGroup.LayoutParams params, View child, boolean isLayoutReverse)
private static void reverseGroup(ViewGroup group, boolean isLayoutReverse)
